alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:26PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rain will impact portions of central Blaine, southeastern Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 819 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several slow moving thunderstorms across Hill and Blaine counties including stronger thunderstorms near Box Elder and about 11 miles northeast Havre with additional cells developing to the north of Chinook and Fort Belknap. These cells were moving south at 10 mph or less. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall in addition to lightning, wind gusts in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rainfall is occurring with some of these storms and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Azure, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Agency, St. Pierre, Sangrey, Boneau, Fort Belknap, Box Elder, Rocky Boy, Lohman, Cleveland, Zurich, Laredo and Lloyd. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
